trans-unit.target: Config flag if PAM is activated or not.

Activates the Multi-VPN function (e.g. search fields for VPN in the standard search, display in ERA-Health) on the user interface.
When the value is set to "Set", the devices for the relevant client are divided by VPN on to the remaining SATs
Controls if the functionality of the location group permission will be shown.
Controls which check boxes are activated by default in the order management.
Carrier Management: Activates the CCI function. Data fields for customer e-mails
Carrier Management: Activates the CCI function. Data fields for customer e-mails (Subject)
Carrier Management: Activates the CCI function. Data fields for customer e-mails.
Activates the administration of technical parameters when ordering circuits (interface, terminating unit, transfer unit)
Activates the transmission of orders from Carrier Management.
Activates the prices in Carrier Management.
Specifies if purchase/sales prices will be entered separately; whether circuits are shown with purchase/sales prices.

This parameter specifies the number of results displayed per page, for, among others, the following menu entries/pages: - selection and search pages for devices and ports - inventory (history, list, overview) - CCC (Template Run) - ERAMON search - syslog reporting - network status - provisioning engine
This flag indicates if the multi-currency feature is activated.
Hiding of device information in Carrier Management.
Date of the most recent billing cycle (up to this date prices can be adjusted).
The cust_sort config flag specifies the sort order for the ports in the device info. Possible values.
Anyterm Login: Connection is directly from CENTER (for "set", otherwise from SAT).
If the ERAMON user name is to be used in the login.
Anyterm will not login automatically (request for user name and password).
Anyterm will not connect through to the enable-mode.
Anyterm: Automatic login without entry of user &password.
Activates the customer per ports behavior.

Default value for ports during scanning in. (Managed, EPM)
These options are possible y (managed) n (unmanaged) a (all ports with Oper-Status up) s (all ports with Admin-Status up)
Is possible for devices in the Device Administration menu and for images in the Device Info > EPM menu.
This flag indicates if passwords are also used for the login templates.
Specifies which community is used for the transmission of announcement traps.
Which port types are to be ignored during correlation (in reference to network topology).
Controls after how many hours an empty containers is to be archived.
This setting indicates when (in minutes) cleared events are to be deleted from the event tool.
Indicates which port is to be used for the transmission of announcement traps.
Activates the entry field so a reason can be entered for an event acknowledgement.
The ack_reason_pflicht config flag turns the "Acknowledge Reason" field into a mandatory field.
Controls the behavior when adding correlated alarms to containers.
This flag indicates if a "BGP Session Down" message is to set off a downtime for the relevant port via the IP provided.
Indicates if a "BGP Neighbor Down" message is to start the SLA calculation.
This flag indicates if a correlation via the network topology (link_master table) is to be carried out.
This flag indicates if a "ospfNghbrStateChanged" message is to set off a downtime for the relevant port via the IP provided.

In this flag you can specify if an event source with a "sysuptime" event source and the message "Device rebooted: … (Date)" should automatically set up a scheduled maintenance task (e.g. after a power failure).
A scheduled maintenance task following a reboot is finished once EPM poll is successfully completed. The start of the device will then be used as the starting time.
This flag indicates if an RCA is to be carried out after a master link correlation (config flag: eep_core_link_master).
Activates the checkbox column in the Event Tool.
Specifies that the error texts are displayed in the Event Tool in HTML.

This flag indicates if clear events are to delete the alarm from events_out or not. As long as an event is not deleted once it is cleared, it will be highlighted in green the event tool.
Description of the values: 0 - A pending event will be deleted by a clear event. 1 - A pending event will be deleted by a clear event if no acknowledge has been carried out prior to this. 2 - Events are never deleted.

This flag indicates if new events should be able to re-open (value 1) already cleared alarms in the Event Tool (green).
Description of values: 0 - the green event will not be re-opened when a renewed down alert occurs. The system simply shows a new event in the event tool. 1 - The green event will be re-opened when a renewed down alert occurs, and will be shown in the event tool as pending.
Activates the query for the error ignore reason.

If activated, it is possible to exclusively clear containers (or more precisely their content) for viewing via the config variable in the NOC view. The default setting of this config flag is for ALL events to be shown.
Controls if a clear event is transmitted for ignored alarms. By default this clear message is sent, unless the config flag has been set!
Specifies that ignoring events via the checkbox is ONLY possible for those events that have not yet been acknowledged.
Controls if acknowledged alarms are shown by default when the "ACK Reason" button is activated. The default setting is for them to be shown.
This flag specifies that the port description will not be displayed in the Event Tool.
In this flag you can specify which reboot reason a "Device rebooted: … (Date)" event has to have in order for it to be removed from SLA calculation via a scheduled maintenance.
This parameter activates the display of the error overview in the status bar. The overview can be edited further via the settings in the event tool.
If the config flag is set, the acknowledged , but cleared, alarms are displayed.
Indicates if the EPM graphs are shown as a base64-encoded inline image or as a link to a jpg-file.
Indicates for how long the 1-minute turbo poll should stay activated.
The "revision" config flag shows the currently used revision on your system. This flag is required for the number of the ERAMON version.
Displays the "Remote Device ID" field for the device edit (read-only)
Site ID for the installation. Usually a unique number identifying the customer (e.g. Customer ID of ERP) are entered at this point.
Number of days after which SQL errors are recorded.
Are SQL errors to be transmitted?
This flag is required for the number of the ERAMON version. The update number is added to the version number.
Sets the threshold value for the HA critical message: "hotstandby: Replication out of sync!"
Sets the threshold value for the HA alert: "hotstandby: Replication out of sync!"
Specifies if PAM is also to process clear events.
Activates if the minimum number of still available IP pool members is not met.
Activates port provisioning in the provisioning tool.
If set, the user has to enter User/PW during the setup of a provisioning job. Otherwise the data held on the login template will be used.
This flag deactivates the turbo poll for interactive reports in the report editor
This flag specifies which SLA entry is to be highlighted with a special color on the user interface.
This flag specifies the color with which an SLA entry is to be displayed on the user interface.
If set (=Set), dropdown fields (master data such as customer or location selection) are sorted by adr1; otherwise the sort is by ikd_nr.
If set (=Set), dropdown fields (master data such as customer or location selection) are sorted by adr1; otherwise the sort is by ikd_nr.
When activated ("set") , this flag sets the location number field into a mandatory field.
This flag indicates the maximum number of clients possible.
"max_date" contains the maximum date that will be shown by default in forms.
This flag is required for SAT pools and serves as the calculation basis for the individual SAT loads.
Validity periods for ERAMON PWs
The "relay_notes" config flag sets the delimiter for e-mail transmissions. If set (=set) a comma is used, otherwise a semicolon.
Specifies the time in hours (h) after which a user would be logged out.
Defines the language used by the system (1=German; 2=English)
Activates the automatic assigning of tickets in the queue to the hostmaster, set in minutes by (<val>).
Resolution of the geo view on the user interface, default setting is 800x600.
Activates a customized welcome screen, either Topology Map at the start or an image. The individual image or map can be saved in "initscreen" in the user table.
Controls if IP-SLA tests in the topology view are activated.
This flag specifies if the UP ports are identified for manually created hierachies.
This parameter controls if during the link selection all link types should be offered for selection as well.
This parameter controls if the default assignment of the placement within Topology View is geographical (the basic standard) or manually (by setting the parameter).
This parameter controls if the functionality of displaying links is enable or not.
Dieser Parameter controls if the functionality of being able to change between physical and logical view is enable or not.
This parameter specifies the default distance (in px) for the list or the UP-ports (in geographical/ manual hierarchies). If not set differently, it is 70px.
If this config flag is set, the "Customer CI" function within the Carrier Management menu will be shown. It is set by default to "Not Set".
This parameter specifies if the (Topology View) starter screen will be populated with all available buttons.
If set, this parameter prevents a combination of weathermap AND bandwidth view.
If selected, the depicted image will be used as a watermark for all EPM statistics.
The color of EPM statistics can be specified at this point.
The background color for the legend in the EPM statistics can be specified at this point.
The color of EPM statistics can be specified at this point.
Activates the table compression for event and EPM archive tables.

Specifies which technology will be used for the display of EPM graphs. This option is applied across all clients.
Possible values: js - interactive JavaScript graph base64 - static PNG as stream png - static PNG as link
If this setting is activated,the user cannot edit the sender address.

Background color of the whole graph.
Example: #161616

Border color of the graph.
Example: #000000

Border radius of the graph (in pixel)
Example: 5

Border width of the graph (in pixel)
Example: 0

Background color of the plotting area of the graph
Example: #161616

Border color of the plotting area of the graph
Example: #000000

Border width of the plotting area of the graph (in pixel)
Example: 0

Selection marker for zooming in graphs
Example: #606060

Specifies if EPM threshold values will be shown in graphs by default.
Possible values: on - the threshold values are displayed by default. off - the threshold values will not be displayed. hidden - the threshold values are hidden by default. auto - the threshold values are displayed if the threshold value deviates by less than 25% from the set minimum/maximum/average value for the time period.

Subtitle for EPM device graphs
It is also possible to use token(s).
Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location

Subtitle of EPM port graphs.
It is also possible to use tokens.
Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #port_name# Port name #port_desc# Port description #port_desc_man# - Port description (manually entered) #port_typ# - Port type #port_speed# - Bandwidth of the port (formatted) #max_bytes# - Bandwidth of the port (read out, in byte) #max_bytes_era# - Bandwidth of the port (manually entered, in Byte) #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location

Title of EPM device graphs
It is also possible to use token.
Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location

Title of EPM port graphs
It is also possible to use token.
Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #port_name# Port name #port_desc# Port description #port_desc_man# - Port description (manually entered) #port_typ# - Port type #port_speed# - Bandwidth of the port (formatted) #max_bytes# - Bandwidth of the port (read out, in byte) #max_bytes_era# - Bandwidth of the port (manually entered, in Byte) #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location

Background color of the legend
Example: #161616

Border color of the legend
Example: #000000

Radius of the border of legends (in pixel)
Example: 5

Border width of the legend (in pixel)
Example: 0

Transparency of areas in graphs
Example: 0.75

Line width for areas
Example: 2

Line width in graphs
Example: 2
The config flag: ignore_reason_pflicht turns the "Ignore Reason" field into a mandatory field.
This parameter controls if reload is allowed in Topology View.
This parameter controls if zooming in submaps is possible. If not set, zooming will be possible.
This parameter controls if the functionality to delete devices directly (!!) in Topology View can be activated.
The config flag activates a message in the header bar indicating that this is customer test system.
By activating the config flags any existing backup scripts of the file manager are used during the device group independent config backup, parallel to the standard backup.
Extended Overview in Header Bar
If the config flag is set all new,open alarms are shown first.

With this configuration parameter you can activate an emergency alarm, for example, if the event processing has been suspended. In the event of an error, an e-mail message would be sent to all clients. Also, a further action (e.g. transmission of SMSs) can be specified via a script. Please contact the ERAMON Support Team for this.

This option specifies the time period (in minutes) during which a correlation via the network topology has taken place. Thus you can, for example, specify that downtimes which occur more than 120 minutes apart, are no longer correlated.
If activated this config flag enables the display of time periods where SNMP polls for the relevant were deactivated, in every EPM graph.
Wenn activated the availability of the device is shown in every EPM graph in a red field.
Activates Carrier Management
Activates the Accounting module.
Activates the Provisioning tool.
Activates the Ticket System module
By default all EPM test inactive for at least 10 days are deleted. This time period can be controlled via the parameters.
Activates the "Invitations for Offers" function in Carrier Management.
A "Y" value during the SAT check leads to a test of the "EPM Buffer" and "CENTER Buffer" contents.

This flag identifies if new events, already cleared and acknowledged alarms are still available in the event tool over and above the default time. It would then be distinguished between cleared and cleared+ACK alarm. All others should only be ignored manually.
This flag activates the sum/average line for table reports in the report editor.
This parameter specifies if the dormant status is to be identified as positive (same as up).
Assigns the ISP circuit name with own and enables the display of own circuit names.

Specifies the minimum y-axis value.
Examples: nil - the graph_lib is scaled automatically, the y-axis does not necessarily start with "0". 0 - The graph will always start with "0".

Specifies the width of the graph (in pixels)
unset = use default

Specifies the height of the large graphs (in pixels):
unset = use default

Specifies the width of the preview graphs (in pixels):
unset = use default

Specifies the height of the preview graphs (in pixels):
unset = use default
If set to "true" this flag will also display a tool tip in the preview images. It is set by default to "false".
If set to "false", this config flag ensures that the tool tip is not displayed in the big images. It is set by default to "true".

Do you want to show the min/max course for the relevant test in the preview graph?
Possible values:
on - courses will be shown. hidden - the processes are deactivated by default, but can be activated via the legend. off - the process are deactivated and not shown in the legend either.

Should min./max. processes for each test be shown in the graph?
Possible values: on - processes will be shown hidden - processes are deactivated by default but can be activated via the legend. off - processes are deactivated and will NOT be shown in the legend either.

This flag allows an adjustment of the calculation sequence of the event cost calculation in the EEP core.
Default: port_grp;dev_grp;lok;kunde;trap
Another example: trap;dev_grp;kunde
This parameter specifies if Layer-2 connections should be used for the topology view.
Specifies the default SLA category for Versatel
Specifies the width (in mm) to which the header image in the pdf report will be scaled.
Specifies the absolute path of the footer image on the ERAMON CENTER for the pdf reports.
Specifies the height (in mm) to which the header image in the pdf reports will be scaled. This specification also applies to the titles.
A brief credits section can be saved which will be shown in every EPM graph in the bottom right-hand corner.
Optionally, you can specify a link that will call up the credits (config flag: graph_lib.credits.text).
Activates the VLAN manager.

The basis for a port template search in the "Lite View" of the dynamic view in the EPM menu is the text entered via the token(s).
Possible Tokens:
#dev_name# #port_name# #port_desc# #port_desc_man# #item_name# #oid_desc#

The basis for a device template search in the "Lite View" of the dynamic view in the EPM menu is the text entered via the token(s).
Possible Tokens: #dev_name# #item_name# #oid_desc#
Specifies the absolute path of the header image on the ERAMON CENTER for the pdf reports.
Specifies the width (in mm) of the header image in the pdf reports.
Specifies the left-hand margin of pdf files (in mm).
Specifies the width (in mm) for the footer image in the pdf reports.
Color of the title in EPM graphs.
Color of Y-Axis Title
Colors for the various legends
Color of Y-Axis Text (normally values)
Color of X-Axis Text (normally dates)
Color of Y-axis gridline
Color of Y-axis gridline
Color of Y-axis minor gridlines
Color of X-axis minor gridlines
Thickness of X-axis minor gridlines (in pixels)
Thickness of Y-axis minor gridlines (in pixels)
Thickness of Y-axis gridlines (in pixels)
Thickness of X-axis gridlines (in pixels)
Color of X-axis
Color of Y-axis
Adjustment of X-axis labels
Adjustment of Y-axis labels
Rotation of X-axis labels
Movement of X-axis labels (in pixels)
Orientation of X-axis labels
Thickness of X-axis line
Thickness of Y-axis line
Line style for X-axis gridline
Line style for Y-axis gridline
Minor grid line-style for X-axis
Minor grid line-style for Y-axis
Color of X-axis ticks
Color of Y-axis ticks
Color of minor X-axis ticks
Color of minor Y-axis ticks
Maximum number of elements in a device group before an alert is issued. For device group dropdowns - at specific locations, e.g. EPM Views.
Maximum number of elements in a port group before an alert is issued. For port group dropdowns - at specific locations, e.g. EPM Views.
Activates the option to store a reporting server.
This flag specifies the time period (in days) after which events with "Normal" prio are deleted from: events_out.

Adjustable time interval specifying when to change to aggregation level 1.
Example: 604800 - For a time period of more than 7 days, aggregation level 1 will be used.
NOTE: This setting may well be influenced by config flag: DISPLAY_INTERVAL_2.

Adjustable time interval specifying when to change to aggregation level 2.
Example: 2678400 - For a time period of more than 31 days, aggregation level 2 will be used.
3456000 - Starting from 40 days.
The logo displayed in the EPM graph. Optionally in png-format and transparent to ensure legibility of the graph's content.
Indicates if the current time interval is didplayed underneath the x-axis of the respective EPM graph.
Activates the option to integrate File Manager scripts in Provisioning.
This setting indicates when (in minutes) cleared events will no longer be shown in the Event Tool.
If this flag is set, no DNS polling for the IP addresses of terminals will occur within "Enter L2 Data". The DNS names of the terminals are therefore not identified and saved in the L2 data.

Specifies if EPM "clear" threshold values will be shown in graphs by default.
Possible values: on - the "clear" threshold values are displayed by default. off - the "clear" threshold values will not be displayed. hidden - the "clear"threshold values are hidden by default. auto - the "clear" threshold values are displayed if the threshold value deviates by less than 25% from the set minimum/maximum/average value for the time period.
NB: If the regular as well as the "clear" threshold values are active and have the same value, they will be merged.
Turbo polling carried out in realtime

Line width in preview graphs
Example: 1
If the value of the parameter is: "set", then lines and areas in EPM graphs will be displayed as step graphs.

This flag indicates if it should be possible to re-open new events with already ignored alarms in the Event Tool.
Description of values: 0 - The ignored event will not be re-opened when a renewed down alert occurs. The system simply shows a new event in the event tool. 1 - The ignored event will be re-opened when a renewed down alert occurs, and will be shown in the event tool as pending.
This value specifies the number of SNMP connection retries.
This value specifies the number of polled variables per SNMP polling.
Specifies the color of the text within the tool tips, with except for the title of the measurement.
Specifies if the page numbers are to be shown in the pdf files.
Allows you to override the color of the legend for the tooltip. If no color is specified the legend is displayed in the respective legend color.

If a device is redistributed from one SAT to another, any open errors will generate a "clear_wait" event. This will be converted into a true clear event once the waiting time is over. The background for this is that theoretically the error could have been cleared in the time it took to complete the SAT change, without this being recognized by either SAT. For this reason any open errors will be cleared after the waiting time (approx. 20 minutes) - unless the now relevant SAT generates a further error message in the meantime.
Specified in minutes.
This overrides the color of the threshold values in the EPM graphs. Otherwise the color of the corresponding measurement would be used.
Line style of the threshold values in the EPM graphs.

Specification of difference in seconds between active and passive DB server as of when it is assumed that the replication was aborted. A "Replication is delayed" event with "Critical" priority will be sent and the ERAMON Infrastructure diplay changed to red.

Specification of difference in seconds between active and passive DB server as of when the "Replication is delayed" event with the "major" priority is sent. In addition to this the ERAMON Infrastructure display will change to amber.
IP address or DNS name of the DB host for the geo DB. If the DB is stored locally on the CENTER (=default), the "127.0.0.1" IP address has to specified.
Name of the geo DB.
Password set in the configuration parameters for the geo db on the geo DB.
Type of database (e.g. MySQL) of the geo DB.
database user of the geo DB

This parameter allows the generation of entries in the /etc/hosts. Examples:
172.10.10.10 ServerA 172.20.20.20 ServerB
Has the following value in the config flag as a result: 172.10.10.10 :ServerA;172.20.20.20:ServerB
Thickness of border for tooltips in EPM graphs.
Border radius of the tooltips in EPM graphs.
Border color for the tooltips in EPM graphs.
Background color for the tooltips in EPM graphs.
Line thickness for areas in preview graphs (EPM).
Text of the information text in the bottom right-hand corner of EPM graphs.
Link of the information text in the bottom right-hand corner of the EPM graphs.
Border color for buttons in EPM graphs.
Border color for temporarily selected buttons in EPM graphs.
Fill color for temporarily selected buttons in EPM graphs.
Mouseover border color for temporarily selected buttons in EPM graphs.
Mouseover fill color for temporarily selected buttons in EPM graphs.
Fill color for the buttons in EPM graphs.
Border color for the icons of buttons in EPM graphs.
Fill color for the icons on the buttons on EPM graphs.
Mouseover font color for legend elements in EPM graphs.
Font color for hidden legend elements in EPM graphs.
Time format for the display of the time frame in EPM graphs.
Changes the color of the border for the "Reset Zoom" button in EPM graphs.
Changes of the mouseover color of the frame for the "Reset Zoom" button in EPM graphs.
Changes of the mouseover fill color of the "Reset Zoom" button in EPM graphs.
Changes of the mouseover font color of the "Reset Zoom" button in EPM graphs.
Changes the fill color of the "Reset Zoom" button in EPM graphs.
Changes the font color of the "Reset Zoom" button in EPM graphs.
If no color specs have been recorded for an EPM graph, the system uses the default set from this parameter in sequence.If the parameter is empty the default setting of the graph-lib is applied.

Changes the additional information shown in the event (device and port name). Possible settings are: remote - display of the remote device and the remote port local - display of the local device and local port none - no display of additional information
Specification of waiting time for PAM "Good" messages in minutes - 5 minutes by default.
Hierarchical dependencies ("Uplink Ports") on topology view maps activated or deactivated.

Changes the additional information shown in the event (device and port name). Possible settings are: remote - display of the remote device and the remote port local - display of the local device and local port none - no display of additional information
Changes the event text of "ospfNbrStateChange" messages assigned to ports. By default set to "OSPF Neighbor Down".
Changes the event text of "BGP Session Down" messages assigned to ports. By default set to "BGP Neighbor Down".

Specifies the time period between the clearance of an event and any subsequent reopening, where the previous ACK reason will be used. If this time period is exceeded, the event will no longer be seen as acknowledged when reopened (an ACK history is available though).This configuration parameter is similiar to "eep_core_keep_ackreason_reopen_ign" - but it only affects events that have not been ignored.
This specification configures the distance of the axes markers Specification in pixels.

Title of EPM device graphs. It is also possible to use tokens when entering the text. Only applies to the report editor.
Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location

Subtitle for EPM device graphs. It is also possible to use tokens when entering the text. Only applies to the report editor.
Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location

Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #port_name# Port name #port_desc# Port description #port_desc_man# - Port description (manually entered) #port_typ# - Port type #port_speed# - Bandwidth of the port (formatted) #max_bytes# - Bandwidth of the port (read out, in byte) #max_bytes_era# - Bandwidth of the port (manually entered, in Byte) #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location

Title of EPM port graphs. It is also possible to use tokens when entering the text. Only applies to the report editor.
Example: #dev_name# - Device name #dev_ip# - Device IP #port_name# Port name #port_desc# Port description #port_desc_man# - Port description (manually entered) #port_typ# - Port type #port_speed# - Bandwidth of the port (formatted) #max_bytes# - Bandwidth of the port (read out, in byte) #max_bytes_era# - Bandwidth of the port (manually entered, in Byte) #kunde_such# - Search expression for customer #kunde_adr# - Address line 1 for customer #kunde_adr2# - Address line 2 for customer #kunde_ort# - City location for customer #kunde_strasse# - Customer's road #kunde_plz# - Customer's post code/ZIP #locations_such# - Search expression for location #locations_adr1# - Address line 1 for location #locations_adr2# - Address line 2 for location #locations_ort# - City for the location #locations_strasse# - Road for the location #locations_plz# - Post code/ZIP for the location
The logo displayed in the EPM graph. Optionally in png-format and transparent to ensure legibility of the graph's content. Only applies to the report editor.
A brief credits' section can be saved which will be shown in every EPM graph in the bottom right-hand corner. Only applies to the report editor.
Optionally, you can specify a link that will call up the credits (config flag: graph_lib.credits.text). Only applies to the report editor.
Specifies if the y-axis is to end with a labelled grid line or can be finished without one.
Specifies if the y-axis is to be finished with a labelled grid line or without one. Only applies to the report editor.

This specification configures the distance of the axes markers. Only applies to the report editor.
Specification in pixels.

Using the "-" character allows you to configure the replacement of the SQL regex through this setting. The "true" value deactivates the replacement of the search expression to regex. Changes will not become active until the next login.
When this config flag is set, the routing table will be read out from all devices/ ports of the recorded port group. The maximum number of routes per device is 20,000.

Specifies the time period between the clearance of an event and any subsequent reopening, where the previous ACK reason will be used. If this time period is exceeded, the event will no longer be seen as acknowledged when reopened (an ACK history is available though). This configuration parameter is similiar to "eep_core_keep_ackreason_reopen" - but it only affects ignored events.
Indicates the amount of Unknown Syslog Messages required within a 24-hour period for a device before an alert is generated in ERAMON.

This parameter controls which port types are to be ignored during the detection of connections for the "Update topology of Topology View" scheduled application. Example: propVirtual,propPointToPointSerial

This configuration parameter specifies the multiplication factor, when a violation would be dismissed and an event generated to notify you of this. It is only used for EPM measurements where the "Use Port Speed as maximum Value" option has been activated. The default value is 1.05. This would result in the dismissal of all values that exceed the maximum port speed by more than 5 percent.
Display text for the VPN name, if for a client with activated Multi-VPN the device is not assigned to a VPN.

This config flag deactivates the display of events within the TTL minimum time period for the main level/root, as long as these events are no subsequent events or part of a container. If it is a main event or part of a container, the event will still be displayed.
This flag specifies the time period (in hours) after which the generated main events for flapping service monitors are deleted; but only those without sub-events.
Activates the synchronization of ERAMON users with those in the active directory. NB: Please refer to the "Authentication" article in the manual for an explanation of permission group mappings.

This parameter specifies the number of hours after which connections of ports that are down are to be deleted.
The following special values need particular attention: -1: The connections are never deleted. Except: When running manual CDP/LLDP scans through the quick action on the device info page all connections are deleted before the scan begins . 0: The connections are deleted as soon as the next CDP/LLDP scan is run.
Background: The SNMP can usually no longer read out any active connections for ports that are down; without any indication if these connections should still exist or are still configured. To ensure these connection do not remain on the system for all times, they are deleted by default after 50 hours.
